RPP Demo
Welcome to RPP Demonstration App> A demonstration application providing Rate Pressure Product (RPP) information and related services to the client.
Contents include brief background of blood pressure (BP), heart rate (HR), and rate pressure product (RPP). Based on the values of RPP, the app suggests personalized and optimal workout routine. The app consists of four parts: introduction, calibration, rpp measurement, and exercise suggestion. By Jieun Ashley Lee of New Device Lab
Blood Pressure and HR What is BP and HR? Blood Pressure (BP) and Heart Rate (HR) are the two most commonly used vital signs.
BP is the pressure exerted by the blood upon the walls of the blood vessels, indicated as SBP / DBP.
Systolic BP (SBP) is the maximum BP when heart pushes the blood around the body, and Diastolic BP (DBP) is the minimum BP when heart rests between the beat. Normal BP is around 120/90; above is considered hypertensive and below is considered as hypotensive HR is the number of times your heart beats per minute. Normal resting HR ranges between 60 and 100. Why is it so important to monitor your BP?
Hypertension, often referred to as the \Silent Killer,\ is the most common cardiovascular disease in America. It can be easily induced by various daily activities, such as caffeine or alcohol intake, stress, and consumption of salty foods.
However, keeping up with BP is not easy for many people, especially for those living busy lives. The reliability of the BP measurements at hospitals is often compromised by the White Coat Effect. Hence, constant and frequent monitoring using smartphones will benefit many people\s lives
Rate Pressure Product Knowing BP is Not Enough The impact of simple measurement is limited without personalized follow-up treatment.
After all, the purpose of constant BP measurement implemented in smartphones is to provide more comprehensive health care at anywhere at anytime. Moreover, the technology should not only help patients suffering from hypertension, but also benefit all people, those whose BP is currently in a normal range. Why RPP? Rate Pressure Product (RPP) is SBP X HR. Traditionally, RPP is used as an index of myocardial O2 consumption, meaning it can measure the energy and O2 demand of heart. Hence, it is a good indicator examining the cardiac function, especially when the energy demand is high.
Like in many journals, RPP is calculated as (SBP X HR)/1000 in this app. Such calculation minimizes the error range caused by not-entirely-accurate BP measurement, and also removes the need to show BP values directly.
RPP and Exercise Applying RPP
Previously, there were attempts of measuring physical stress level only based on HR. However, without information about BP, measuring stress solely based on HR is clearly limited. On the other hand, RPP can effectively show the degree of physical stress and exercise intensity, as studied in "The rate-pressure-product as a determinant of myocardial blood flow during dipyridamole stress in healthy, young volunteers" by Meter at al. and many other journals. Personal Trainer on Every Smartphone
Exercise is not only important for keeping BP in a desirable level, but also for living a fit and healthy life. Everyone has different cardio-capacity and it is often difficult to find the most optimal work-out routine. Due to the properties stated previously, based on the RPP measured during the exercise and recovery, the values can be used to determine the exercise intensity. Ultimately, it can be used to suggest different exercises to try out in the future. With time, the clients will be able to build up an optimal work-out routine. How does it work?
RPP during exercise can be divided into 4 levels; Normal (~12), Risk (13~17), Danger (18~21), and Very Danger (21~). If a client\s RPP is Normal, exercise of same or slightly higher intensity will be suggested. If it is at Risk, exercise of the same or slightly lower intensity will be suggested. If RPP is considered to be Danger or Very Danger, exercise of lower intensity will be suggested.
If the activity with RPP greater than 21 is continued more than 2 minutes, the app will have pop-up notification recommending the user to stop the current activity.
